Take a tour. Sample wares. Grab some appetizers and unique brews on tap. Get a growler to go. And be sure to allow time to visit some of the neighboring merchants in Maplewood.

Great location and saved us as we were just starting to get "hangry" after the excitement of the Arch. It was within walking distance and we were greeted warmly and promptly seated. The server was very helpful with the menu and we really enjoyed the toasted ravioli. She was very helpful in making accommodations for our kids orders as well.

We were tired on our arrival in St Louis after a long car journey and as we were staying over at The Drury Plaza we decided to eat here and it was a good choice. The service was friendly and spot on and the food was great value for money and very tasty.

I'd recommend the Lombardo's Famous Ravioli while dining at this nice authentic Italian restaurant.
We also tried the Asian Sesame Chicken Salad, and the Smoked Turkey Club.
The staff was friendly and attentive. We were there for lunch, but would enjoy dinner there too I'm sure.

On your way to the Arch you can stop here to eat. Great price and taste. Service is awesome. It is a small business and they really want to have you enjoy your food. Thanks for the best eating of a Missourian pizza.

Went in to grab a bite after returning from the conference. Friendly staff. Great food, reasonable prices for all the food you get. Huge sandwich and large amount of fries. Attached to the Drury Inn at the Arch, access through the lobby. Loved the accessibility.

Great food, excellent beers, eclectic servers, with easy parking and access. Enjoy a first class, but reasonably-priced, St. Louis favorite.

The place is a quiet reprieve from the airport that serves from a limited menu but the food is very tasty.

St. Louis has its own style of pizza. It is known as Imo's. Don't laugh, it's true. Imo's is like no other. It is slightly on the sweet side but you can offset that with some hot sauce or pepper flakes. You're Welcome.

I had not had Imo's Pizza in 16 years so I decided to try a piece. I should have stayed away. The provel cheese does not taste like anything natural. I think you have to be from St Louis to like it.

Sticky provel (nasty processed product) cheese, thin crust and strange sauce. Only people born in St. Louis who have never experienced real pizza (Italy, New York, Chicago, etc.) like this stuff. You are better off with a good frozen pizza.

Imo's always has the best pizza you can eat. This location was nice. Nice big windows. Easy access location. Right next to St. Louis Zoo and Forest Park.

I never appreciated how good St Louis pizza was until I moved away! Now every time I visit, I make sure to get some Imo's. This time we went to the Hampton location, and it did not disappoint. It was very busy, but we didn't wait long, and the food was FANTASTIC. Can't wait your go again.

don't miss imos in st louis
its a st louis ledgend like ted drews ice cream, ravioli, pork steaks, and goodey butter cake

My husband and I were visiting a friend in St. Louis. It was our first time in the city and he said we had to try Imo's. It did not disappoint! Excellent flatbread pizza. We got the 16" and it was more than enough to feed three people. He also had us try the fried ravioli, which was also good!

Imos was much better before they change the sauce 20 years ago... but still if you can find a location that uses the old sauce, its the best pizza ever!!!

We absolutely love Chimi's! Their food is great. Not greasy at all. I am very picky about Mexican food and this is about the only place I'll eat. Their chimichangas are great and their margaritas are the bet in town. Locals in Overland go weekly!

The fajitas are really good. I also tried a Mexican chicken soup and it was really good. If you like Margaritas, they make a pretty good one.

Very good service and the combo fajitas (steak and chicken) were really delicious. The restaurant is very colorful- loved the atmosphere! Even the chips and salsa served upon arrival, (literally as we sat down) were very good- it was a mild, fresh salsa- my favorite kind and the best I have ever had!

Food is always good. Wide variety of real Mexican food. Ask for the Salsa Verde! Try the ice cold beers with one of the house specialties!

It was great to be able to chill on the roof and get a snack and something to eat while barely interrupting the kids play time. Lots of seating and fun just to look around.

Prices are reasonable - $5-6 for tacos, nachos, hot dogs, chili, and hamburgers. They also have ice cream and candy. Drink include water ($2), gatorade ($2), and alcoholic beverages. Good place to stop, have a snack and rest before hitting the rest of the museum.

If you are an adult this could be enough at the City Musuem. Really the museum is geared around kids and young families.

You can work up an appetite while playing and exploring. They have tacos, hot dogs, and chili! Excellent for a snack! Plus the roof top lets you see the city while eating. What a view!

City Museum is such a funky place. It's refreshing that the food service options are all unique and not a big corporate vending contract. Our items weren't cheap, but we didn't feel taken advantage of. Drinks selection was good, and you can't beat the location. It's worth the extra five bucks to get up here.
